sections.title: Syntax
sections.raw_content:
A tagStatement is:

  tag unionVariableReference , expn

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: A tag statement is a special-purpose assignment that is used for changing the tag of a union variable.
sections.mdown_content: A **tag** statement is a special-purpose assignment that is used for changing the tag of a **union** variable.

sections.title: Example
code:
type vehicleInfo :
            union kind : passenger .. recreational
                label passenger :
                    cylinders : 1..16
                label farm :
                    farmClass : string ( 10 )
                label : % No fields for "otherwise" clause
            end union
        var v : vehicleInfo
        
        tag v, passenger        % Activate passenger part
sections.raw_content: In this example, the tag field of union variable v is set to be passenger, thereby activating the passenger field of v.
sections.mdown_content: In this example, the tag field of **union** variable *v* is set to be *passenger*,* *thereby activating the *passenger* field of *v*.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
A tag statement is the only way to modify the tag field of a union variable (other than by assigning an entire union value to the union variable).

You cannot access a particular set of fields of a union unless the tag is set to match the corresponding label value.
sections.mdown_content:
A **tag** statement is the only way to modify the tag field of a **union** variable (other than by assigning an entire union value to the union variable).
You cannot  access a particular set of fields of a **union** unless the tag is set to match the corresponding label value.
